+ codex plan approve &lt;plan-id&gt;
+ codex plan execute &lt;plan-id&gt;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### 3. Sub-Agent Delegation
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Single agent
+ codex delegate code-reviewer --scope ./src
+ 
+ # Parallel agents (2.6x faster)
+ codex delegate-parallel code-reviewer,test-gen \
+   --scopes ./src,./tests
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### 4. Git 4D Visualization
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Terminal UI (3D+time)
+ codex git-analyze --cuda
+ 
+ # GUI (Three.js)
+ codex-gui  # Tauri app
+ 
+ # VR mode (Quest 2/3/Pro)
+ # Open in browser and click &quot;Enter VR&quot;
+ open http://localhost:3000/git-vr
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### 5. Deep Research
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Research with citations
+ codex research &quot;Rust async best practices&quot; \
+   --depth 3 \
+   --strategy comprehensive
+ 
+ # Output: Markdown report with sources
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+

+ #!/usr/bin/env node
+ /**
+  * Post-install script for @zapabob/codex-cli
+  * Downloads pre-built binaries from GitHub Releases
+  */
+ 
+ const https = require(&#39;https&#39;);
+ const fs = require(&#39;fs&#39;);
+ const path = require(&#39;path&#39;);
+ const crypto = require(&#39;crypto&#39;);
+ const { promisify } = require(&#39;util&#39;);
+ const pipeline = promisify(require(&#39;stream&#39;).pipeline);
+ 
+ const VERSION = &#39;2.0.0&#39;;
+ const GITHUB_REPO = &#39;zapabob/codex&#39;;
+ 
+ // Platform detection
+ function getPlatformInfo() {
+   const platform = process.platform;
+   const arch = process.arch;
+   
+   const platformMap = {
+     win32: { os: &#39;windows&#39;, ext: &#39;.exe&#39;, archive: &#39;zip&#39; },
+     darwin: { os: &#39;macos&#39;, ext: &#39;&#39;, archive: &#39;tar.gz&#39; },
+     linux: { os: &#39;linux&#39;, ext: &#39;&#39;, archive: &#39;tar.gz&#39; },
+   };
+   
+   const archMap = {
+     x64: &#39;x64&#39;,
+     arm64: &#39;arm64&#39;,
+   };
+   
+   if (!platformMap[platform]) {
+     throw new Error(&#96;Unsupported platform: ${platform}&#96;);
+   }
+   
+   if (!archMap[arch]) {
+     throw new Error(&#96;Unsupported architecture: ${arch}&#96;);
+   }
+   
+   return {
+     ...platformMap[platform],
+     archName: archMap[arch],
+   };
+ }
+ 
+ // Download file from URL
+ async function downloadFile(url, dest) {
+   return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {
+     https.get(url, { followAllRedirects: true }, (response) =&gt; {
+       if (response.statusCode === 302 || response.statusCode === 301) {
+         downloadFile(response.headers.location, dest).then(resolve).catch(reject);
+         return;
+       }
+       
+       if (response.statusCode !== 200) {
+         reject(new Error(&#96;Failed to download: HTTP ${response.statusCode}&#96;));
+         return;
+       }
+       
+       const file = fs.createWriteStream(dest);
+       pipeline(response, file)
+         .then(() =&gt; resolve())
+         .catch(reject);
+     }).on(&#39;error&#39;, reject);
+   });
+ }
+ 
+ // Verify SHA256 checksum
+ async function verifySHA256(filePath, expectedHash) {
+   const hash = crypto.createHash(&#39;sha256&#39;);
+   const stream = fs.createReadStream(filePath);
+   
+   return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {
+     stream.on(&#39;data&#39;, (data) =&gt; hash.update(data));
+     stream.on(&#39;end&#39;, () =&gt; {
+       const computed = hash.digest(&#39;hex&#39;);
+       resolve(computed === expectedHash);
+     });
+     stream.on(&#39;error&#39;, reject);
+   });
+ }
+ 
+ // Extract archive
+ async function extractArchive(archivePath, destDir) {
+   const { promisify } = require(&#39;util&#39;);
+   const exec = promisify(require(&#39;child_process&#39;).exec);
+   
+   const ext = path.extname(archivePath);
+   
+   if (ext === &#39;.zip&#39;) {
+     // Windows: use unzip or 7z
+     try {
+       await exec(&#96;powershell -command &quot;Expand-Archive -Path &#39;${archivePath}&#39; -DestinationPath &#39;${destDir}&#39; -Force&quot;&#96;);
+     } catch {
+       await exec(&#96;7z x &quot;${archivePath}&quot; -o&quot;${destDir}&quot; -y&#96;);
+     }
+   } else if (archivePath.endsWith(&#39;.tar.gz&#39;)) {
+     // Unix: use tar
+     await exec(&#96;tar -xzf &quot;${archivePath}&quot; -C &quot;${destDir}&quot;&#96;);
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ async function main() {
+   console.log(&#39;ğŸ“¦ Installing @zapabob/codex-cli v&#39; + VERSION);
+   
+   try {
+     const platformInfo = getPlatformInfo();
+     console.log(&#96;ğŸ–¥ï¸  Platform: ${platformInfo.os}-${platformInfo.archName}&#96;);
+     
+     // Binary filename
+     const binaryName = &#96;codex-${platformInfo.os}-${platformInfo.archName}${platformInfo.ext}&#96;;
+     const downloadUrl = &#96;https://github.com/${GITHUB_REPO}/releases/download/v${VERSION}/${binaryName}&#96;;
+     
+     console.log(&#96;â¬‡ï¸  Downloading: ${downloadUrl}&#96;);
+     
+     // Ensure bin directory exists
+     const binDir = path.join(__dirname, &#39;..&#39;, &#39;bin&#39;);
+     if (!fs.existsSync(binDir)) {
+       fs.mkdirSync(binDir, { recursive: true });
+     }
+     
+     const binaryPath = path.join(binDir, &#39;codex&#39; + platformInfo.ext);
+     const tempPath = path.join(binDir, &#39;codex.tmp&#39;);
+     
+     // Download binary
+     await downloadFile(downloadUrl, tempPath);
+     console.log(&#39;âœ… Download complete&#39;);
+     
+     // Move to final location
+     fs.renameSync(tempPath, binaryPath);
+     
+     // Make executable (Unix)
+     if (platformInfo.os !== &#39;windows&#39;) {
+       fs.chmodSync(binaryPath, 0o755);
+     }
+     
+     console.log(&#96;âœ… Installed: ${binaryPath}&#96;);
+     console.log(&#39;&#39;);
+     console.log(&#39;ğŸ‰ Installation complete!&#39;);
+     console.log(&#39;&#39;);
+     console.log(&#39;Run: codex --version&#39;);
+     console.log(&#39;Or:  npx @zapabob/codex-cli --version&#39;);
+     
+   } catch (error) {
+     console.error(&#39;âŒ Installation failed:&#39;, error.message);
+     console.error(&#39;&#39;);
+     console.error(&#39;ğŸ’¡ Alternative: Install from source&#39;);
+     console.error(&#39;   git clone https://github.com/zapabob/codex.git&#39;);
+     console.error(&#39;   cd codex/codex-rs&#39;);
+     console.error(&#39;   cargo install --path cli&#39;);
+     process.exit(1);
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ if (require.main === module) {
+   main();
+ }
+

+ impl GitVisualizer3D {
+     /// Timeline control initialization
+     fn init_timeline(&amp;self) -&gt; TimelineControl {
+         let timestamps: Vec&lt;i64&gt; = self.commits.iter()
+             .map(|c| c.timestamp)
+             .collect();
+         
+         let start_time = *timestamps.iter().min().unwrap_or(&amp;0);
+         let end_time = *timestamps.iter().max().unwrap_or(&amp;0);
+         
+         TimelineControl {
+             start_time,
+             end_time,
+             current_time: end_time, // Start from latest
+             speed: 1.0,
+             window_size: 86400 * 30, // 30 days window
+         }
+     }
+     
+     /// Filter commits by time window
+     fn filter_by_time(&amp;self, time: i64, window: i64) -&gt; Vec&lt;&amp;CommitNode3D&gt; {
+         self.commits.iter()
+             .filter(|c| c.timestamp &gt;= time - window &amp;&amp; c.timestamp &lt;= time)
+             .collect()
+     }
+     
+     /// Render time axis (4th dimension)
+     fn render_time_axis(&amp;self, frame: &amp;mut Frame, area: Rect) {
+         let timeline = format!(
+             &quot;Timeline: {} â†’ {} (Current: {})&quot;,
+             timestamp_to_string(self.time_control.start_time),
+             timestamp_to_string(self.time_control.end_time),
+             timestamp_to_string(self.time_control.current_time)
+         );
+         
+         let paragraph = Paragraph::new(timeline)
+             .style(Style::default().fg(Color::Cyan))
+             .block(Block::default().borders(Borders::ALL).title(&quot;Time Axis&quot;));
+         
+         frame.render_widget(paragraph, area);
+     }
+     
+     /// Calculate heat level (commit frequency)
+     fn calculate_heat(&amp;self, commit: &amp;CommitNode3D) -&gt; f32 {
+         let window = 86400 * 7; // 7 days
+         let nearby_commits = self.commits.iter()
+             .filter(|c| (c.timestamp - commit.timestamp).abs() &lt; window)
+             .count();
+         
+         (nearby_commits as f32 / 100.0).min(1.0) // Normalize to 0-1
+     }
+     
+     /// Playback control (time animation)
+     pub fn tick_playback(&amp;mut self, delta_time: f32) {
+         if !self.playback_active {
+             return;
+         }
+         
+         let time_delta = (delta_time * self.playback_speed * 86400.0) as i64; // days
+         self.current_time += time_delta;
+         
+         if self.current_time &gt; self.time_control.end_time {
+             self.current_time = self.time_control.start_time; // Loop
+         }
+         
+         self.time_control.current_time = self.current_time;
+     }
+     
+     /// Render with time filtering (4D visualization)
+     pub fn render_4d(&amp;mut self, frame: &amp;mut Frame, area: Rect) {
+         // Filter commits by current time window
+         let visible_commits = self.filter_by_time(
+             self.current_time,
+             self.time_control.window_size
+         );
+         
+         // Render 3D graph with time-filtered commits
+         self.render_3d_filtered(frame, area, &amp;visible_commits);
+         
+         // Render time axis
+         let time_area = Rect::new(area.x, area.y + area.height - 3, area.width, 3);
+         self.render_time_axis(frame, time_area);
+     }
+ }

+ #### 2.2 Tauri GUI 3Då¯è¦–åŒ–ï¼ˆThree.jsï¼‰

+ **æ–°è¦ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«**: &#96;codex-rs/tauri-gui/src/pages/GitVisualization3D.tsx&#96;
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { Canvas, useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { OrbitControls, Text, Line } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ 
+ interface Commit4D {
+   pos: [number, number, number]
+   hash: string
+   message: string
+   timestamp: number
+   heat: number
+   changes: number
+ }
+ 
+ function CommitNode({ commit, visible }: { commit: Commit4D; visible: boolean }) {
+   const meshRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Mesh&gt;(null)
+   
+   useFrame(() =&gt; {
+     if (meshRef.current) {
+       meshRef.current.rotation.y += 0.01
+     }
+   })
+   
+   const color = new THREE.Color().setHSL(commit.heat, 0.8, 0.5)
+   const size = Math.log(commit.changes + 1) * 0.5
+   
+   if (!visible) return null
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;mesh ref={meshRef} position={commit.pos}&gt;
+       &lt;sphereGeometry args={[size, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+       &lt;meshStandardMaterial color={color} /&gt;
+       &lt;Text
+         position={[0, size + 0.5, 0]}
+         fontSize={0.3}
+         color=&quot;white&quot;
+       &gt;
+         {commit.hash.substring(0, 7)}
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     &lt;/mesh&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ function TimeAxis({ startTime, endTime, currentTime }: { 
+   startTime: number
+   endTime: number
+   currentTime: number 
+ }) {
+   const progress = (currentTime - startTime) / (endTime - startTime)
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;group&gt;
+       &lt;Line
+         points={[[-50, -20, 0], [50, -20, 0]]}
+         color=&quot;cyan&quot;
+         lineWidth={2}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;mesh position={[-50 + progress * 100, -20, 0]}&gt;
+         &lt;sphereGeometry args={[0.5, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+         &lt;meshStandardMaterial color=&quot;yellow&quot; /&gt;
+       &lt;/mesh&gt;
+       &lt;Text
+         position={[-50 + progress * 100, -22, 0]}
+         fontSize={0.5}
+         color=&quot;white&quot;
+       &gt;
+         {new Date(currentTime * 1000).toLocaleDateString()}
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ export default function GitVisualization3D() {
+   const [commits, setCommits] = useState&lt;Commit4D[]&gt;([])
+   const [currentTime, setCurrentTime] = useState(Date.now() / 1000)
+   const [playing, setPlaying] = useState(false)
+   const [speed, setSpeed] = useState(1.0)
+   const [windowSize, setWindowSize] = useState(86400 * 30) // 30 days
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // Load commits from Rust backend
+     loadCommitsFromRust()
+   }, [])
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     if (!playing) return
+     
+     const interval = setInterval(() =&gt; {
+       setCurrentTime(t =&gt; {
+         const newTime = t + speed * 86400 // 1 day per tick
+         const maxTime = Math.max(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp))
+         return newTime &gt; maxTime ? Math.min(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)) : newTime
+       })
+     }, 100)
+     
+     return () =&gt; clearInterval(interval)
+   }, [playing, speed, commits])
+   
+   const visibleCommits = commits.filter(c =&gt; 
+     c.timestamp &gt;= currentTime - windowSize &amp;&amp; c.timestamp &lt;= currentTime
+   )
+   
+   const startTime = commits.length &gt; 0 ? Math.min(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)) : 0
+   const endTime = commits.length &gt; 0 ? Math.max(...commits.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)) : 0
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;div style={{ width: &#39;100vw&#39;, height: &#39;100vh&#39; }}&gt;
+       &lt;Canvas camera={{ position: [0, 0, 100], fov: 60 }}&gt;
+         &lt;ambientLight intensity={0.5} /&gt;
+         &lt;pointLight position={[10, 10, 10]} /&gt;
+         &lt;OrbitControls /&gt;
+         
+         {visibleCommits.map(commit =&gt; (
+           &lt;CommitNode key={commit.hash} commit={commit} visible={true} /&gt;
+         ))}
+         
+         &lt;TimeAxis startTime={startTime} endTime={endTime} currentTime={currentTime} /&gt;
+       &lt;/Canvas&gt;
+       
+       &lt;div style={{ position: &#39;absolute&#39;, bottom: 20, left: 20, color: &#39;white&#39; }}&gt;
+         &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; setPlaying(!playing)}&gt;
+           {playing ? &#39;â¸ Pause&#39; : &#39;â–¶ Play&#39;}
+         &lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; setSpeed(speed * 2)}&gt;â© Speed x{speed}&lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; setSpeed(Math.max(0.25, speed / 2))}&gt;âª Slow&lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;div&gt;
+           Visible: {visibleCommits.length} / {commits.length} commits
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+         &lt;div&gt;
+           Time: {new Date(currentTime * 1000).toLocaleString()}
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+   
+   async function loadCommitsFromRust() {
+     try {
+       const { invoke } = await import(&#39;@tauri-apps/api/tauri&#39;)
+       const data = await invoke&lt;Commit4D[]&gt;(&#39;get_git_commits_4d&#39;)
+       setCommits(data)
+       if (data.length &gt; 0) {
+         setCurrentTime(Math.max(...data.map(c =&gt; c.timestamp)))
+       }
+     } catch (err) {
+       console.error(&#39;Failed to load commits:&#39;, err)
+     }
+   }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ **Tauri ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰è¿½åŠ ** (&#96;codex-rs/tauri-gui/src-tauri/src/git_commands.rs&#96;):
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ #[tauri::command]
+ pub async fn get_git_commits_4d() -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;Commit4D&gt;, String&gt; {
+     use git2::Repository;
+     
+     let repo = Repository::open(&quot;.&quot;)
+         .map_err(|e| format!(&quot;Failed to open repo: {}&quot;, e))?;
+     
+     let mut revwalk = repo.revwalk()
+         .map_err(|e| format!(&quot;Failed to create revwalk: {}&quot;, e))?;
+     
+     revwalk.push_head()
+         .map_err(|e| format!(&quot;Failed to push head: {}&quot;, e))?;
+     
+     let commits: Vec&lt;Commit4D&gt; = revwalk
+         .take(10000)
+         .filter_map(|oid| {
+             let oid = oid.ok()?;
+             let commit = repo.find_commit(oid).ok()?;
+             
+             Some(Commit4D {
+                 pos: calculate_3d_position(&amp;commit),
+                 hash: format!(&quot;{}&quot;, oid),
+                 message: commit.message().unwrap_or(&quot;&quot;).to_string(),
+                 timestamp: commit.time().seconds(),
+                 heat: 0.5, // TODO: Calculate
+                 changes: commit.tree().ok()?.len(),
+             })
+         })
+         .collect();
+     
+     Ok(commits)
+ }

Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {\n        // Hyper-V PowerShellã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ç”Ÿæˆ\n        let vm_name = format!(\&quot;Codex-VM-{}\&quot;, uuid::Uuid::new_v4());\n        \n        let ps_script = format!(r#\&quot;\nNew-VM -Name \&quot;{}\&quot; -MemoryStartupBytes 4GB -Generation 2\nAdd-VMHardDiskDrive -VMName \&quot;{}\&quot; -Path \&quot;C:\\Hyper-V\\{}.vhdx\&quot; -NewVHD -SizeBytes 50GB\nSet-VMProcessor -VMName \&quot;{}\&quot; -Count 4\nStart-VM -Name \&quot;{}\&quot;\n\&quot;#, vm_name, vm_name, vm_name, vm_name, vm_name);\n        \n        let output = std::process::Command::new(\&quot;powershell.exe\&quot;)\n            .arg(\&quot;-Command\&quot;)\n            .arg(&amp;ps_script)\n            .output()?;\n        \n        if !output.status.success() {\n            return Err(anyhow::anyhow!(\&quot;Failed to create Hyper-V VM: {}\&quot;, String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr)));\n        }\n        \n        Ok(SandboxInstance {\n            id: vm_name,\n            sandbox_type: SandboxType::HyperV,\n        })\n    }\n    \n    async fn create_wsl2_distro(&amp;self, config: SandboxConfig) -&gt; Result&lt;SandboxInstance&gt; {\n        // WSL2 ã‚«ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ ãƒ‡ã‚£ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ä½œæˆ\n        let distro_name = format!(\&quot;Codex-WSL-{}\&quot;, uuid::Uuid::new_v4());\n        \n        // Ubuntu Baseã‚’ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆ\n        let output = std::process::Command::new(\&quot;wsl\&quot;)\n            .args(&amp;[\&quot;--import\&quot;, &amp;distro_name, &amp;format!(\&quot;C:\\\\WSL\\\\{}\&quot;, distro_name), \&quot;ubuntu-base.tar.gz\&quot;])\n            .output()?;\n        \n        if !output.status.success() {\n            return Err(anyhow::anyhow!(\&quot;Failed to create WSL2 distro\&quot;));\n        }\n        \n        // Codexã‚’ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«\n        std::process::Command::new(\&quot;wsl\&quot;)\n            .args(&amp;[\&quot;-d\&quot;, &amp;distro_name, \&quot;-e\&quot;, \&quot;bash\&quot;, \&quot;-c\&quot;, \&quot;curl -fsSL https://install.codex.sh | sh\&quot;])\n            .output()?;\n        \n        Ok(SandboxInstance {\n            id: distro_name,\n            sandbox_type: SandboxType::Wsl2,\n        })\n    }\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 5.3 MCPçµŒç”±ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹åˆ¶å¾¡\n\n**ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«**: &#96;codex-rs/mcp-server/src/tools/sandbox_tools.rs&#96;\n\nMCPãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¨ã—ã¦å…¬é–‹ï¼š\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\npub struct SandboxTools {\n    manager: Arc&lt;SandboxManager&gt;,\n}\n\nimpl SandboxTools {\n    pub fn register_tools(&amp;self) -&gt; },\n                        \&quot;enable_gpu\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;boolean\&quot;, \&quot;default\&quot;: true },\n                        \&quot;enable_network\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;boolean\&quot;, \&quot;default\&quot;: true }\n                    }\n                }),\n            },\n            Tool {\n                name: \&quot;execute_in_sandbox\&quot;.to_string(),\n                description: \&quot;Execute command in sandbox OS\&quot;.to_string(),\n                input_schema: json!({\n                    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;object\&quot;,\n                    \&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n                        \&quot;sandbox_id\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;string\&quot; },\n                        \&quot;command\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;string\&quot; }\n                    }\n                }),\n            },\n            Tool {\n                name: \&quot;destroy_sandbox\&quot;.to_string(),\n                description: \&quot;Destroy sandbox OS instance\&quot;.to_string(),\n                input_schema: json!({\n                    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;object\&quot;,\n                    \&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n                        \&quot;sandbox_id\&quot;: { \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;string\&quot; }\n                    }\n                }),\n            }\n        ]\n    }\n    \n    pub async fn handle_tool_call(&amp;self, tool_name: &amp;str, args: Value) -&gt; Result&lt;Value&gt; {\n        match tool_name {\n            \&quot;create_sandbox_os\&quot; =&gt; {\n                let sandbox_type = args[\&quot;sandbox_type\&quot;].as_str().unwrap();\n                let config = SandboxConfig {\n                    workspace_path: PathBuf::from(args[\&quot;workspace_path\&quot;].as_str().unwrap()),\n                    enable_gpu: args[\&quot;enable_gpu\&quot;].as_bool().unwrap_or(true),\n                    enable_network: args[\&quot;enable_network\&quot;].as_bool().unwrap_or(true),\n                };\n                \n                let instance = self.manager.create_sandbox_os(config).await?;\n                \n                Ok(json!({\n                    \&quot;sandbox_id\&quot;: instance.id,\n                    \&quot;type\&quot;: sandbox_type,\n                    \&quot;status\&quot;: \&quot;running\&quot;\n                }))\n            }\n            \&quot;execute_in_sandbox\&quot; =&gt; {\n                let sandbox_id = args[\&quot;sandbox_id\&quot;].as_str().unwrap();\n                let command = args[\&quot;command\&quot;].as_str().unwrap();\n                \n                let output = self.manager.execute_command(sandbox_id, command).await?;\n                \n                Ok(json!({\n                    \&quot;stdout\&quot;: output.stdout,\n                    \&quot;stderr\&quot;: output.stderr,\n                    \&quot;exit_code\&quot;: output.exit_code\n                }))\n            }\n            \&quot;destroy_sandbox\&quot; =&gt; {\n                let sandbox_id = args[\&quot;sandbox_id\&quot;].as_str().unwrap();\n                self.manager.destroy_sandbox(sandbox_id).await?;\n                \n                Ok(json!({\n                    \&quot;status\&quot;: \&quot;destroyed\&quot;\n                }))\n            }\n            _ =&gt; Err(anyhow::anyhow!(\&quot;Unknown tool: {}\&quot;, tool_name))\n        }\n    }\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 5.4 CLIã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰è¿½åŠ \n\n**ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«**: &#96;codex-rs/cli/src/main.rs&#96;\n\næ–°è¦ã‚µãƒ–ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ï¼š\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\n#[derive(Parser, Debug)]\nenum Subcommand {\n    // ... æ—¢å­˜ã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰\n    \n    /// Manage sandbox OS environments\n    Sandbox {\n        #[command(subcommand)]\n        command: SandboxCommand,\n    },\n}\n\n#[derive(Parser, Debug)]\nenum SandboxCommand {\n    /// Create new sandbox OS\n    Create {\n        /// Sandbox type: windows_sandbox, hyperv, wsl2, appcontainer\n        #[arg(long, default_value = \&quot;windows_sandbox\&quot;)]\n        sandbox_type: String,\n        \n        /// Workspace path to mount\n        #[arg(long)]\n        workspace: PathBuf,\n    },\n    \n    /// List active sandboxes\n    List,\n    \n    /// Execute command in sandbox\n    Exec {\n        /// Sandbox ID\n        sandbox_id: String,\n        \n        /// Command to execute\n        command: String,\n    },\n    \n    /// Destroy sandbox\n    Destroy {\n        /// Sandbox ID\n        sandbox_id: String,\n    },\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 5.5 ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å†…GUIãƒ»ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ç’°å¢ƒ\n\n**æ–°è¦ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒª**: &#96;codex-rs/sandbox-os-gui/&#96;\n\nLinux/macOSé¢¨ã®è¦‹ãŸç›®ã¨å®Ÿè£…ã‚’æŒã¤ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å°‚ç”¨GUIï¼š\n\n#### 5.5.1 ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å°‚ç”¨ã‚·ã‚§ãƒ«\n\n**ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«**: &#96;codex-rs/sandbox-os-gui/src/sandbox_shell.rs&#96;\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\npub struct SandboxShell {\n    environment: HashMap&lt;String, String&gt;,\n    working_dir: PathBuf,\n    command_history: Vec&lt;String&gt;,\n    isolation_mode: IsolationMode,\n}\n\npub enum IsolationMode {\n    FullIsolation,      // å®Œå…¨é®æ–­ï¼ˆãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ»ãƒ›ã‚¹ãƒˆé€šä¿¡ãªã—ï¼‰\n    RestrictedAccess,   // åˆ¶é™ä»˜ããƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å…±æœ‰ã®ã¿\n}\n\nimpl SandboxShell {\n    pub fn new(isolation_mode: IsolationMode) -&gt; Self {\n        let mut env = HashMap::new();\n        env.insert(\&quot;HOME\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;/home/sandbox\&quot;.to_string());\n        env.insert(\&quot;USER\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;sandbox\&quot;.to_string());\n        env.insert(\&quot;SHELL\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;/bin/codex-shell\&quot;.to_string());\n        env.insert(\&quot;PATH\&quot;.to_string(), \&quot;/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin\&quot;.to_string());\n        \n        Self {\n            environment: env,\n            working_dir: PathBuf::from(\&quot;/home/sandbox\&quot;),\n            command_history: vec![],\n            isolation_mode,\n        }\n    }\n    \n    pub async fn execute_command(&amp;mut self, cmd: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;CommandOutput&gt; {\n        self.command_history.push(cmd.to_string());\n        \n        // ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’å®Œå…¨é®æ–­\n        if self.isolation_mode == IsolationMode::FullIsolation {\n            if cmd.contains(\&quot;curl\&quot;) || cmd.contains(\&quot;wget\&quot;) || cmd.contains(\&quot;ping\&quot;) {\n                return Err(anyhow::anyhow!(\&quot;Network access denied in full isolation mode\&quot;));\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒœãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹å†…å°‚ç”¨ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰å®Ÿè£…\n        let parts: Vec&lt;&amp;str&gt; self.cmd_pwd(),\n            Some(&amp;\&quot;cat\&quot;) =&gt; self.cmd_cat(parts.get(1)),\n            Some(&amp;\&quot;echo\&quot;) =&gt; self.cmd_echo(&amp;parts[1..]),\n            Some(&amp;\&quot;mkdir\&quot;) =&gt; +     pub fn advance(&amp;mut self, delta: f32) {
+         let delta_time = (delta * self.speed) as i64;
+         self.current_time = (self.current_time - delta_time).clamp(self.start_time, self.end_time);
+     }
+ 
+     /// Set timeline position (0.0-1.0, where 0.0 is start, 1.0 is end)
+     pub fn set_position(&amp;mut self, position: f32) {
+         let pos = position.clamp(0.0, 1.0);
+         let time_range = self.end_time - self.start_time;
+         self.current_time = self.start_time + ((time_range as f32 * pos) as i64);
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get visible commits within current time window
+     pub fn get_visible_commits&lt;&#39;a&gt;(&amp;self, all_commits: &amp;&#39;a [CommitNode3D]) -&gt; Vec&lt;&amp;&#39;a CommitNode3D&gt; {
+         let window_start = self.current_time - self.window_size;
+         let window_end = self.current_time;
+ 
+         all_commits
+             .iter()
+             .filter(|commit| {
+                 commit.timestamp &gt;= window_start &amp;&amp; commit.timestamp &lt;= window_end
+             })
+             .collect()
+     }
+ 
+     /// Adjust playback speed
+     pub fn adjust_speed(&amp;mut self, delta: f32) {
+         self.speed = (self.speed + delta).clamp(0.1, 100.0);
+     }
+ 
+     /// Adjust window size (in days)
+     pub fn adjust_window(&amp;mut self, delta_days: i64) {
+         self.window_size = (self.window_size + delta_days * 86400).clamp(86400, 86400 * 365);
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get progress as 0.0-1.0
+     pub fn get_progress(&amp;self) -&gt; f32 {
+         if self.end_time == self.start_time {
+             return 1.0;
+         }
+         let elapsed = self.current_time - self.start_time;
+         let total = self.end_time - self.start_time;
+         (elapsed as f32) / (total as f32)
+     }
+ }
  
  /// FPS Counter

+ //! Ollama inference engine implementation
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use codex_ollama::{GenerateRequest, OllamaClient};
+ use serde_json::json;
+ use tokio_stream::Stream;
+ 
+ /// Ollama inference engine
+ pub struct OllamaInferenceEngine {
+     client: OllamaClient,
+     model: String,
+     max_tokens: usize,
+ }
+ 
+ impl OllamaInferenceEngine {
+     /// Create new Ollama engine
+     pub fn new(base_url: Option&lt;String&gt;, model: String) -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         let url = base_url.unwrap_or_else(|| &quot;http://localhost:11434&quot;.to_string());
+         let client = OllamaClient::new(&amp;url).context(&quot;Failed to create Ollama client&quot;)?;
+ 
+         Ok(Self {
+             client,
+             model,
+             max_tokens: 4096,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Perform inference (non-streaming)
+     pub async fn infer(&amp;self, prompt: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+         let request = GenerateRequest {
+             model: self.model.clone(),
+             prompt: prompt.to_string(),
+             options: Some(json!({
+                 &quot;num_predict&quot;: self.max_tokens,
+                 &quot;temperature&quot;: 0.7,
+             })),
+             stream: Some(false),
+             ..Default::default()
+         };
+ 
+         let response = self
+             .client
+             .generate(request)
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Ollama inference failed&quot;)?;
+ 
+         Ok(response.response)
+     }
+ 
+     /// List available models
+     pub async fn list_models(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;String&gt;&gt; {
+         let models = self
+             .client
+             .list_models()
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to list Ollama models&quot;)?;
+ 
+         Ok(models.into_iter().map(|m| m.name).collect())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Stream inference (for real-time output)
+     pub async fn stream_infer(&amp;self, prompt: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;impl Stream&lt;Item = Result&lt;String&gt;&gt;&gt; {
+         let request = GenerateRequest {
+             model: self.model.clone(),
+             prompt: prompt.to_string(),
+             stream: Some(true),
+             ..Default::default()
+         };
+ 
+         self.client
+             .generate_stream(request)
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to start streaming inference&quot;)
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use super::*;
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_ollama_inference() {
+         // Skip if Ollama server not running
+         let engine = match OllamaInferenceEngine::new(None, &quot;gpt-oss:20b&quot;.to_string()) {
+             Ok(e) =&gt; e,
+             Err(_) =&gt; return, // Skip test if Ollama unavailable
+         };
+ 
+         let output = engine.infer(&quot;Hello, world!&quot;).await;
+         if let Ok(text) = output {
+             assert!(!text.is_empty());
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     #[tokio::test]
+     async fn test_list_models() {
+         let engine = match OllamaInferenceEngine::new(None, &quot;gpt-oss:20b&quot;.to_string()) {
+             Ok(e) =&gt; e,
+             Err(_) =&gt; return,
+         };
+ 
+         let models = engine.list_models().await;
+         if let Ok(list) = models {
+             assert!(!list.is_empty());
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
```
